definitions: fit or suitable for people to live in with necessary conditions for life
describing a place or environment that provides adequate shelter and safety for human occupation
examples: The renovated house is finally habitable after months of repairs
Mars might become habitable with advanced terraforming technology
The storm shelter remained habitable throughout the hurricane
They searched for habitable land away from the flood zone

definitions: done or happening as a normal routine or regular practice over time
characteristic of someone's usual behavior or typical way of acting
examples: His habitual morning coffee keeps him energized for work
The habitual lateness of trains frustrated daily commuters
She displayed her habitual kindness by helping the stranger
His habitual optimism helped the team through difficult times

definitions: lacking originality or freshness due to being used too often in writing or speech
examples: The movie relied on hackneyed plot twists everyone could predict
His speech was full of hackneyed phrases about success
The hackneyed metaphor failed to capture the audience's attention
She avoided hackneyed expressions in her creative writing

definitions: looking exhausted and unwell, especially from fatigue, worry, or suffering
examples: After three sleepless nights, she looked haggard and pale
The haggard refugees arrived after their dangerous journey
His haggard face showed the strain of caring for his sick child
The marathon runners appeared haggard at the finish line

definitions: having hair of a specified type, color, or amount when used in combinations
examples: The fair-haired child played happily in the garden
A long-haired cat requires regular grooming and care
The red-haired woman stood out in the crowded room
Gray-haired wisdom comes from years of life experience

definitions: having no hair on the body or a particular part of the body
examples: The hairless cat breed requires special care in cold weather
Some swimmers prefer hairless legs for better performance
The chemotherapy left him temporarily hairless but hopeful
Hairless mice are commonly used in laboratory research

definitions: having a lot of hair or covered with hair on the body or surface
informal way to describe something dangerous, difficult, or frightening to deal with
examples: The hairy dog needed a trim before summer arrived
His hairy arms were visible beneath his rolled-up sleeves
Driving through the storm was a hairy experience for everyone
The negotiations became hairy when both sides refused compromise

definitions: permissible or lawful according to Islamic law, especially regarding food and its preparation
examples: The restaurant serves only halal meat to its customers
She looked for halal-certified products at the grocery store
Halal food preparation follows specific religious guidelines carefully
The hotel offers halal dining options for Muslim guests

definitions: denoting a period of time that was idyllically happy, peaceful, and prosperous
examples: They remembered the halcyon days of their youth fondly
The company enjoyed halcyon years before the market crashed
Those halcyon summer afternoons by the lake seemed endless
The halcyon period of peace lasted nearly two decades

definitions: showing strong health and physical vigor, especially in old age
examples: At ninety, grandmother remains hale and walks daily
The hale farmer worked his fields from dawn to dusk
Despite his age, he appeared hale and hearty at the reunion
The mountain air kept the villagers hale throughout their lives

definitions: regarded as holy or deeply respected, often due to age, tradition, or association
examples: Students walk through the hallowed halls of the ancient university
The hallowed ground of the battlefield became a memorial
They spoke in hushed tones within the hallowed temple walls
The hallowed traditions of the ceremony remained unchanged

definitions: experiencing hallucinations or perceiving things that are not actually present in reality
examples: The fever left him hallucinating strange visions all night
The patient was hallucinating due to the medication's side effects
Without water, the desert travelers began hallucinating mirages
She wondered if she was hallucinating the strange sounds

definitions: of, resembling, or causing hallucinations or having a dreamlike, unreal quality
examples: The artist's hallucinatory paintings depicted surreal dreamscapes
The fever produced hallucinatory episodes throughout the night
The hallucinatory effects of the drug lasted several hours
His hallucinatory visions inspired his most creative works

definitions: causing hallucinations or altered perceptions when consumed or administered to a person
examples: Some mushrooms contain hallucinogenic compounds that affect perception
The shaman used hallucinogenic plants in religious ceremonies
Scientists study hallucinogenic substances for potential therapeutic uses
The hallucinogenic properties of the drug were well documented

definitions: brought to a stop or characterized by limping or impaired walking movement
examples: The halt traffic created long delays during rush hour
All halt progress must be reported to the supervisor immediately
His halt gait resulted from an old sports injury
The horse's halt movement concerned the veterinarian greatly

definitions: slow and hesitant, especially through lack of confidence or with frequent pauses
examples: She spoke in halting English as she learned the language
His halting steps showed he was still recovering from surgery
The student gave a halting presentation due to nervousness
Their halting progress through the jungle worried the guide

definitions: shaped, formed, or flattened by repeated blows with a hammer or similar tool
informal term for being very drunk or intoxicated from alcohol consumption
examples: The hammered copper pot gleamed in the kitchen light
She wore hammered silver earrings to the formal event
He got completely hammered at his bachelor party last night
The hammered guests could barely walk straight after midnight

definitions: having or using a particular hand as dominant, used in combinations like right-handed
examples: The left-handed student needed special scissors for art class
Most tools are designed for right-handed people unfortunately
The one-handed catch amazed everyone watching the game
Two-handed typing increases speed and reduces strain significantly

definitions: designed to be held and operated with one or both hands while portable
examples: The handheld device fits easily in your pocket or bag
Gamers enjoy handheld consoles during long commutes
The handheld scanner makes inventory checks much faster
She preferred handheld tools for detailed craft work

definitions: having a physical or mental condition that limits movement, senses, or activities
put at a disadvantage or hindered in achieving something due to circumstances
examples: The building provides ramps for handicapped visitors' accessibility
Handicapped parking spaces are located near the entrance
The team felt handicapped by their lack of proper equipment
Bad weather handicapped their efforts to finish construction

definitions: managed, controlled, or dealt with in a particular way or by someone
equipped with a handle or handles for carrying, holding, or controlling
examples: The crisis was handled professionally by the management team
She handled the delicate situation with remarkable grace
The handled basket made carrying groceries much easier
All handled tools should be stored safely after use

definitions: made by hand rather than by machine, often implying better quality or uniqueness
examples: She treasured the handmade quilt her grandmother had sewn
The handmade chocolates cost more but tasted exceptional
Local artisans sell handmade jewelry at the weekend market
Each handmade piece has unique characteristics and charm

definitions: written with a pen or pencil rather than typed or printed by machine
examples: The handwritten letter felt more personal than an email
Her handwritten notes were difficult to read but heartfelt
Students submitted handwritten essays for the final exam
The handwritten menu added charm to the small restaurant

definitions: convenient to handle or use, useful, or easily accessible when needed
skilled at using one's hands or at practical tasks and repairs
examples: Keep a handy toolkit in your car for emergencies
The handy storage boxes organize everything perfectly
He's handy with power tools and fixes things himself
She's handy in the kitchen and creates amazing meals

definitions: lacking any obvious principle of organization, random, or carelessly arranged without planning
examples: Books were stacked in haphazard piles throughout the room
Their haphazard approach to planning caused many problems
The haphazard parking made navigation difficult for emergency vehicles
She criticized the haphazard way the project was managed

definitions: unfortunate and deserving pity, especially through having consistently bad luck
examples: The hapless tourist got lost and missed his flight
A hapless team suffered their tenth consecutive defeat
The hapless victim fell for yet another online scam
Our hapless hero stumbled from one disaster to another

definitions: relating to the sense of touch or to tactile sensations and perceptions
examples: The new phone features haptic feedback for better user experience
Haptic technology helps blind people navigate digital interfaces
Virtual reality systems use haptic gloves for realistic sensations
The haptic response confirmed the button press successfully

definitions: subjected to aggressive pressure, intimidation, or persistent annoyance causing distress
examples: The harassed employee finally reported the workplace bullying
She felt harassed by constant phone calls from telemarketers
The harassed mother juggled three jobs and childcare
Harassed wildlife may abandon their natural habitats permanently

definitions: describing a book bound with rigid protective covers rather than flexible paper
examples: The hardback edition costs more than the paperback version
Collectors prefer hardback books for their personal libraries
She waited months for the hardback release of the novel
Hardback textbooks withstand heavy use throughout the semester

definitions: the most active, committed, or strict members of a group or movement
extreme, intense, or uncompromising in nature, content, or dedication to something
examples: Only hardcore fans waited hours in the rain for tickets
She's a hardcore fitness enthusiast who never misses workouts
The movie contains hardcore violence unsuitable for children
His hardcore dedication to training impressed the coach

definitions: describing a book with rigid protective covers made of cardboard covered with cloth or paper
examples: The hardcover version includes exclusive bonus chapters
Libraries typically purchase hardcover books for durability
Her hardcover collection fills three large bookshelves completely
Publishers release hardcover editions before paperback versions

definitions: made hard or harder through a physical or chemical process
made tough, unfeeling, or cynical through difficult experiences over time
examples: The hardened steel blade cuts through metal easily
Hardened concrete forms the building's strong foundation
Years of war created hardened soldiers with few emotions
The hardened criminal showed no remorse during sentencing

definitions: adhering to firm, uncompromising policies or positions, especially in politics
examples: The hardline approach to negotiations left no room for compromise
Hardline politicians refused to consider any policy changes
His hardline stance on immigration divided the party members
The company took a hardline position against union demands

definitions: tending to work with energy and commitment, putting effort into tasks consistently
examples: The hardworking student earned scholarships through dedication
Hardworking employees often receive promotions and recognition
Her hardworking nature impressed everyone at the company
The hardworking farmers rise before dawn every day

definitions: capable of enduring difficult conditions, showing robustness and resilience to hardship
examples: Hardy plants survive the harsh winter temperatures easily
The hardy explorers endured months in Antarctic conditions
These hardy mountain people adapted to high altitude living
Choose hardy vegetables for your first garden attempt

definitions: causing or likely to cause harm, injury, or damage to someone or something
examples: Smoking has harmful effects on your lungs and heart
The harmful chemicals were removed from the water supply
Harmful radiation requires protective equipment for safety
Gossip can be harmful to workplace relationships and morale

definitions: not able or likely to cause harm, damage, or injury to anyone or anything
examples: The spider looks scary but is completely harmless to humans
His harmless joke made everyone laugh without offending anyone
Most snakes in this area are harmless and avoid people
The harmless prank resulted in smiles rather than anger

definitions: relating to or characterized by musical harmony or the physics of harmonic frequencies
examples: The harmonic overtones created a rich, full sound
Musicians study harmonic progression to compose better music
The harmonic vibrations of the strings produced beautiful resonance
Harmonic analysis helps engineers prevent structural failures

definitions: forming a pleasing or consistent whole, free from disagreement or discord
examples: The harmonious colors in the painting create visual balance
Their harmonious relationship lasted over fifty years together
The harmonious blend of voices filled the concert hall
A harmonious workplace increases productivity and job satisfaction

definitions: brought into consonance, agreement, or harmony with something else, using British spelling
examples: The harmonised regulations apply across all member countries
Their harmonised efforts produced excellent results quickly
The harmonised standards ensure product compatibility worldwide
Harmonised voices created a beautiful choral performance

definitions: brought into consonance, agreement, or harmony with something else, using American spelling
examples: The harmonized tax codes simplified international business transactions
Harmonized safety standards protect workers across industries
The choir harmonized perfectly during the holiday concert
They harmonized their schedules to spend more time together

definitions: brought under control and made use of, especially regarding natural forces or resources
examples: Solar energy can be harnessed to power entire communities
The harnessed river provides electricity for three cities
She harnessed her creativity to build a successful business
Properly harnessed emotions can fuel positive change

definitions: feeling strained as a result of having demands persistently made on one
examples: The harried parent managed three children while shopping
Harried commuters rushed to catch their delayed trains
The harried assistant juggled multiple urgent deadlines simultaneously
She looked harried after dealing with difficult customers all day

definitions: causing extreme distress, fear, or anguish through difficulty or danger
examples: Survivors shared harrowing tales of the natural disaster
The harrowing documentary exposed human trafficking realities
Her harrowing experience changed her perspective on life forever
The harrowing journey through the war zone tested everyone

definitions: done or acting with excessive speed or urgency without proper thought or care
examples: His hasty decision to quit proved costly later on
The hasty repairs failed during the first storm
Don't make hasty judgments without knowing all the facts
Their hasty departure left many questions unanswered

definitions: emerged from an egg or developed and emerged from a confined space
marked with fine parallel lines used in drawing or engraving for shading
examples: The newly hatched chicks chirped for their mother's attention
Scientists observed how baby turtles hatched on the beach
The hatched pattern on the map indicated mountainous terrain
Her hatched drawing technique created realistic shadows

definitions: regarded with intense dislike, hostility, or disgust by someone or many people
examples: The hated tax increase sparked protests across the city
He became the most hated villain in movie history
The hated rival team finally lost the championship game
Her hated chores always waited until the last minute

definitions: arousing, deserving of, or filled with hatred toward someone or something
extremely unpleasant, offensive, or disagreeable in nature or effect
examples: His hateful comments hurt everyone in the room deeply
The hateful graffiti was quickly removed from the building
The hateful weather ruined our vacation plans completely
She found the tedious work hateful and sought new employment

definitions: arrogantly superior and disdainful, showing an attitude of superiority over others
examples: Her haughty manner alienated potential friends at school
The haughty aristocrat refused to speak with common people
His haughty expression showed contempt for their suggestions
The haughty tone of the letter offended its recipients

definitions: inhabited or frequented by ghosts or supernatural beings according to belief
showing signs of mental anguish or tormented by persistent disturbing memories
examples: The old haunted mansion attracted thrill-seeking tourists annually
Local legends claim the haunted cemetery contains restless spirits
His haunted eyes revealed years of wartime trauma
She felt haunted by the poor decisions of her past
